\title{Vector Addition / Subtraction} \\
%text Adding / Subtracting vectors, Triangle Law %

reason.tex: %text Since the components along each unit vector are in the same direction, any two vectors $\ora{A}$ and $\ora{B}$ can be added/subtracted as shown. % \begin{align} \ora{A}&=\vector{a_1}{a_2}{a_3} \\ \ora{B}&=\vector{b_1}{b_2}{b_3} \\ \ora{A}\pm\ora{B}&=\vector{(a_1\pm b_1)}{(a_2\pm b_2)}{(a_3\pm b_3)} \end{align} \\ %text Further, their displacement vector $\ora{AB}$ is given by $\ora{B}-\ora{A}$. If $\ora{A}$, $\ora{B}$ and $\ora{C}$ are three vectors then, % \begin{align} \ora{AB}+\ora{BC}=\ora{AC} \end{align} \\ %text This is known as the{\bf triangle law} of vector addition. %
